items.sentence: Tom had a pain in his chest, so he went to the hospital.
Tom had already bought his ticket by the time I arrived.
Tom had barely enough money to pay his bills last month.
Tom had enough money to buy everything he needed to buy.
For some reason, I\'m wide awake and can\'t fall asleep.
Tom and Mary stopped kissing when John entered the room.
Have I ever told you about what Tom and I did in Boston?
Have you ever heard the story of the boy who cried wolf?
Don\'t throw away this magazine. I haven\'t read it yet.
I bet I\'m not the only one who didn\'t do his homework.
I can see you\'re busy, so I\'ll get right to the point.
I will send you a copy of this picture as soon as I can.
I wish I had gone with the others to the game yesterday.
There were quite a few students absent from class today.
These clothes are not appropriate for a cold winter day.
It would be stupid to climb that mountain in the winter.
The only thing Tom likes to do after dinner is watch TV.
The police think that Tom was the one who poisoned Mary.
The prices at the supermarket where I go are reasonable.
The sooner you clear the matter up with Tom, the better.
